{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3752085,"name":"","username":"aaaaaaaa","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/ecc23a/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-09-30T03:09:19.642Z","cooked":"

Hi, our team is looking into getting L bracket manufacturing outsourced for the upcoming season since last year we used many and were thinking it would save a lot of time. Does anyone have any experience with this, like would this be something actually worth it to do from your experience or if you do this where do you get them manufactured? we are based in NYC. thank you!!!

REV Robotics

Aluminum Angle - 0.74in x 0.74in - 47in

REV Robotics designs, builds and manufactures robotics parts and components used by students for learning about science, technology, engineering, and math (STEM). Our parts are commonly used within the FIRST Robotics Competition and the FIRST Tech...

Price: USD 20

REV, WCP and AndyMark all have their own flavour of pre-drilled/punched aluminum angle which works great if that’s what OP is looking for.

If the goal is something more custom, than I’d try looking into services like that of Fabworks or SendCutSend, and having the angle made from formed/bent aluminum. It’s worth noting that services like these require you to be able to provide a CAD model of the parts you want.

0.74in x 0.74in - 47in","clicks":1},{"url":"https://sendcutsend.com/","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"SendCutSend: Custom Sheet Metal Fabrication","clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":2695,"username":"ngreen","name":"Nelson Green (1108 Mentor Coach Electrical Programming)","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ngreen/{size}/264478_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":19532,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Brian Wagg"},"post_url":"/t/l-bracket-manufacturing-outsourced/506713/5","custom_user_title":"Brian Wagg","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3752350,"name":"CEF","username":"CEF","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/c/35a633/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-09-30T15:08:19.897Z","cooked":"

L brackets like this: QTY 8 - Aluminum L Gussets - 5mm Hole Size

or like this: Whoops, we couldn't find that.

?

sendcutsend.com will happily do either for you and, if you have enough quantity, the price-per-unit can get pretty reasonable.

If you’re looking at doing the second one, then you might do what we do: get a length of 2x2 right-angle aluminum and just cut chunks off of it.

Adding onto this, Fabworks also does sheet metal bending and cutting. The advantage of fabworks is that it’s owned by an FRC person and also you can use a number of discount codes to support FRC teams on the site (eg “FRC9442”).
